Key Match Events: Jose Berrios returns to the infamous mound where he was pulled after just three innings during Game 2 of last season’s wild-card round.

The Blue Jays’ right-hander enters this game dealing, pitching to a 1.88 ERA and limiting opponents to a .212 batting average over his last four starts, all of which have lasted at least seven innings.

Minnesota ranks 19th in batting average and 21st in OPS over its last 15 games, and current Twins batters have combined for a .201 expected batting average and .311 expected slugging over 103 plate appearances against the Toronto right-hander.
Although rookie Zebby Mathews has been effective on the mound for Minnesota, he shouldn't be favored by this much in this spot.
The Blue Jays lineup, despite being shut down by Pablo Lopez last night, has been much better in the second half of the season.
Pre-Game Insights: Jose Berrios returns to Target Field tonight, and if history is any indication, the Blue Jays right-hander is poised for a big night on the mound.
Toronto will look to even the series when they hand the ball to Jose Berrios, while Minnesota counters with rookie Zebby Mathews.

Miscellaneous Highlights: The Under is 8-4 in the last 12 meetings between these two teams.
These teams continue to play tight, low-scoring games. With yesterday's 2-0 Twins win, they've combined for six runs or fewer in five of the last six meetings.
